books.title: Mark Rutherford’s Deliverance
books.author: Mark Rutherford
books.summary: A man struggles to makes sense of his experiences in his hard-pressed London life.

books.title: The Lost World
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: A team of scientists and adventurers explores a prehistoric land.

books.title: Confessions of an English Opium-Eater
books.author: Thomas De Quincey
books.summary: A portrait of the life of a drug addict in Georgian-era London.

books.title: Queen Victoria
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: A sardonic and generally unflattering biography of Victoria Alexandrina, Queen of England.

books.title: Darby O’Gill and the Good People
books.author: Herminie Templeton Kavanagh
books.summary: When Tipperary man Darby O’Gill is imprisoned by the fairies of Sleive-na-mon in their home under the hollow mountain, he starts a lasting friendship with their King Brian Connors.

books.title: Man and Superman
books.author: George Bernard Shaw
books.summary: Jack Tanner flees both London and responsibility when he is made guardian of his childhood friend Ann Whitehead.

books.title: Our American Cousin
books.author: Tom Taylor
books.summary: A rough American from a distant branch of the Trenchard family returns to England and quickly becomes embroiled in the family’s affairs.

books.title: Dorothy and the Wizard in Oz
books.author: L. Frank Baum
books.summary: A young girl and her companions travel through dangerous underground realms with the help of an old friend.

books.title: Modeste Mignon
books.author: Honoré de Balzac
books.summary: A young daughter seeks independence on her own terms.

books.title: Melmoth the Wanderer
books.author: Charles Robert Maturin
books.summary: A set of overlapping tales tell the story of a mysterious, malevolent, ageless stranger.

books.title: My Four Weeks in France
books.author: Ring Lardner
books.summary: A sports columnist and humorist travels to France as a war correspondent during World War I and recounts his experiences on the assignment.

books.title: The Memoirs of Sherlock Holmes
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: The world’s first consulting detective and his companion investigate further crimes and mysteries, culminating in a life-or-death struggle with an evil nemesis.

books.title: The Lives of the Caesars
books.author: Suetonius
books.summary: The lives of the twelve emperors called Caesar are described in detail by a near-contemporary Roman historian.

books.title: Culture and Anarchy
books.author: Matthew Arnold
books.summary: Matthew Arnold describes what he considers to be the flaws in Victorian British society.

books.title: Eugene Onegin
books.author: Alexander Pushkin
books.summary: A jaded Russian fop’s disdain for the world catches up with him.

books.title: Sartor Resartus
books.author: Thomas Carlyle
books.summary: The meta-fictional commentary on the life of “famous” German philosopher Diogenes Teufelsdröckh and his Philosophy of Clothes.

books.title: Beyond Thirty
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: A young naval officer finds himself in a forbidden part of the world after storms waylay his ship.

books.title: The Conjure Woman
books.author: Charles W. Chesnutt
books.summary: Former slave Julius tells fantastical tales about plantation life to the incredulous Northerners who have just moved in.

books.title: Heretics
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: A collection of essays in which G. K. Chesterton debates the intellectuals of his day on a range of topics.

books.title: The Four Men
books.author: Hilaire Belloc
books.summary: Hilaire Belloc takes a pilgrimage across his beloved home English county of Sussex writing as four distinct personalities, with a wide variety of songs, stories, and digressions.
